body: We have `isInThePast()` but that's a [date assertion](https://www.javadoc.io/doc/org.assertj/assertj-core/latest/org/assertj/core/api/AbstractDateAssert.html#isInThePast()) so it would make sense to add them for the date/time introduced in java 8.
Hi @joel-costigliola is it possible to work on this issue?
@StefanBratanov thanks! please pick one of the task and raise a PR for it.
Awesome. Thank you @joel-costigliola, and @StefanBratanov for taking this on :)

issue.title: Add `isInThePast` and `isInTheFuture` to LocalDate assertions

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
#### Check List:
* Fixes one of the tasks in #2932 
* Unit tests : YES
* Javadoc with a code example (on API only) : YES
* PR meets the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/assertj/assertj/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

Two things I am unsure about:
- The correctness of the `@since` version
- `ShouldBeInTheFuture/ThePast` error message contains the class name (java.time.LocalDate). This seems to be the behaviour of the `MessageFormatter` handling dates classes. Is the error message ok like this?

issue.title: Add `isInThePast` and `isInTheFuture` to the missing Java 8 date/time types

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
#### Check List:
* Fixes #2932 
* Unit tests : YES
* Javadoc with a code example (on API only) : YES
* PR meets the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/assertj/assertj/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

- Add the missing assertions for `Instant` `LocalDateTime` `OffsetDateTime` `ZonedDateTime` since they follow the same patterns. Decided it makes sense to make them one PR.
- Not sure if is necessary to implement `invoke_api_method` and `verify_internal_effects` for the `ZonedDateTimeAssert` and the `OffsetDateTimeAssert` tests. I implemented them as no-op.

body:
> thanks @StefanBratanov for your contribution.

No worries. Thank you for maintaining the library. :)

issue.title: Consider adding isNotInThePast and isNotInTheFuture

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
#### Feature summary

This is an another syntactic sugar follows https://github.com/assertj/assertj/issues/2932.

There are cases to verify an `Instant` is **not** in the future no matter how small the gap between the instant and `now()`.


#### Example

```java
final var entity = persist();
assertThat(entity.getCreatedAt()).isNotNull()
//    .isInThePast() // may fail, **technically**
    .isNotInTheFuture() // may be equal to the `now()`
    .isBeforeOrEqualTo(now) // an already existing alternative
    ;
```
